pullRequest.body:
The image of a left invariant measure under right addition is left invariant, and if the measure was a Haar measure it is
stays a Haar measure.

---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

nodes.body: Hey, it's been two weeks since the last review @eric-wieser @Komyyy. Mind giving the PR another look?
bors merge

  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6114893246/job/16597384840)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6114893246/job/16597384966)
Looks pretty good to me but I'm not an expert in this part of the library. I left a couple of minor comments. Thanks for the PR!

Thanks! Here are the last few nitpicks, please merge this after fixing them and checking that everything compiles.

bors d+
Looks pretty good to me but I'm not an expert in this part of the library. I left a couple of minor comments. Thanks for the PR!
Could you merge master to make sure that everything still works? Otherwise I think this looks good!

Thanks! Here are the last few nitpicks, please merge this after fixing them and checking that everything compiles.

bors d+
This should be possible to prove as a special case of `isMulLeftInvariant_smul` with `MulOpposite`; do we already have that `SMul` version?
I am not sure about this? The measure I refer to is `A -> \mu(A g^-1)`, and to my understanding, `smul` is the measure `A -> c \mu(A)`.

The statement I'm thinking of is something like
```lean
theorem SMulInvariantMeasure_smul
    {α β} [MeasurableSpace α] [MeasurableSpace β] [SMul α G] [SMul β G] [SMulCommClass α β G]
    [MeasurableSMul α G] [MeasurableSMul β G] [SMulInvariantMeasure β G μ] (a : α) :
    SMulInvariantMeasure β G (map (a • ·) μ) :=
```
@urkud is probably more qualified here than me
I see. I think the even more general case is the following. If M, N are G-modules, M equipped with a G-invariant measure `\mu` and `f: M \to N` is a homomorphism, then `f_* \mu` is invariant.
I'll write it out and get this as a special case.

```suggestion
  conv_rhs =>
    rw [← map_mul_left_eq_self μ h, map_map (measurable_mul_const _) (measurable_const_mul _)]
  congr 2 with y
```
Can you remove the `hS` from both the `intro` and `exact`? Sometimes these things cancel out.
It didn't :(
Do the `by` and `exact` cancel out? One means "go from term mode to tactic mode" and the other means "go from tactic mode to term mode".
Yep :)
Doesn't the `simps` above already generate this lemma?
#6343; it generates it, but it has the wrong name.
CI is failing, I think for this reason.
Can you state this for `SmulHomClass` instead?
Actually, I'll push the fix now

I think this style is preferred:
```suggestion
theorem isHaarMeasure_rmul [BorelSpace G] [TopologicalGroup G] [T2Space G] (g : G) :
    IsHaarMeasure (Measure.map (· * g) μ) where
  toIsMulLeftInvariant := isMulLeftInvariant_rmul g
  lt_top_of_isCompact K hK := by
    rw [map_apply (measurable_mul_const _) hK.measurableSet]
    apply IsCompact.measure_lt_top _
    rwa [← Homeomorph.coe_mulRight g, Homeomorph.isCompact_preimage _]
  toIsOpenPosMeasure := (continuous_mul_right g).isOpenPosMeasure_map (mul_right_surjective g)
```

@eric-wieser Hey, If you would look at the PR one last time it would be great!
In particular, if you have an idea as to how to avoid the annoying ; rfl here it would be much appreciated!
I attempted a fix, but will need to wait for CI again to look further.
Looks like it passed, thanks!
I've split these results to #6491; they're no longer useful in this PR.
I ended up dropping `SMulHomClass` here as it didn't work with `to_additive`.
For each of these additive versions, can you write a docstring about "scalar addition"?

This one should generalize to something like
```suggestion
theorem isHaarMeasure_smul [BorelSpace G] [TopologicalGroup G] [T2Space G] (a : α) :
    IsHaarMeasure (Measure.map (a • · : G → G)  μ) where
  toIsMulLeftInvariant := isMulLeftInvariant_smul a
```
though you will have to add some assumption on `α`. You should then be able to prove `isHaarMeasure_rmul` in a single line like I did with `isMulLeftInvariant_rmul`
Should this be an `instance`?
The other similar theorems around here aren't instances, so I am not sure
`ha` is a `ContinuousConstSMul` typeclass

I'd be tempted to make this slightly less general but easier to use:
```suggestion
theorem isHaarMeasure_map_smul {α} [Group G] [BorelSpace G] [TopologicalGroup G] [T2Space G] [MulAction α G]
    [SMulCommClass α G G] [MeasurableSpace α] [MeasurableSMul α G] [ContinuousConstSMul α G] (a : α) :
```
I believe you can then use `Homeomorph.smul` instead of `Homeomorph.mulRight`.
How about asking (a • ·) to be a homeomorphism?
I suspect that's not a useful generalization; if that's a homeomorphism then you can pretty much always interpret `a` as an element of `Units α` and then my `Group` version applies.
Maybe @urkud has an opinion here?
I added it, could you check the PR again? @eric-wieser
I think having that for a group action is perfectly fine.

Could you also add the following version and deduce that right invariant measures are preserved by left multiplication?
```lean
theorem isMulRightInvariant_map_smul
    {α} [SMul α G] [SMulCommClass α Gᵐᵒᵖ G] [MeasurableSpace α] [MeasurableSMul α G]
    [IsMulRightInvariant μ] (a : α) :
    IsMulRightInvariant (map (a • · : G → G) μ) :=
  (forall_measure_preimage_mul_right_iff _).1 <| fun x _ hs =>
    (SMulInvariantMeasure_map_smul μ a).measure_preimage_smul (MulOpposite.op x) hs
```

Actually @eric-wieser I'm not sure how useful these intermediate "mul and smul" versions are: the general version is `SMulInvariantMeasure_map_smul`, and the one which are really useful in practice are the purely multiplicative one. If someone needs an intermediate case they can just use the most general version pretty easily, right?

In any case, this general version definitely allows us to prove that right invariant measures are preserved by left multiplication, so we should add that.

Which versions are you advocating removing? I think the picture would be clearer here if `IsMulLeftInvariant` and the corresponding `SMulInvariantMeasure` were defeq to each other (though I don't know if that refactor is actually a good idea, and it certainly doesn't belong in this PR).

A point in favor of the intermediate "smul and mul" versions is that we have similar intermediate versions for algebra like `smul_mul_assoc` and `mul_smul_comm`

What I was suggesting is going straight from `SMulInvariantMeasure_map_smul` to `isMulLeftInvariant_rmul`. But indeed the fact that there is no immediate way to go from `SMulInvariantMeasure` to `IsMulLeftInvariant` is a good enough reason to keep the intermediate step at least for now. 

I'd say we keep them as ~~`def`s~~ `theorem`s, and make the other one `instances`. Does that sound good?
Do you mean as `theorem`s?
I'm not sure I understood, which are you suggesting to make an `instance`? @ADedecker

Using the names I suggested below: `smulInvariantMeasure_map_smul`, `isMulLeftInvariant_map_mul_right`, and `isHaarMeasure_map_mul_right`. The idea is to have instances for *smul* invariance of smul, and *mul* invariance of *mul*, does that make sense? 

Btw, I think you missed the suggestion at the beginning of this discussion :wink:
Thanks! @ADedecker

Although we use `SMul`, the name "scalar multiplication is really misleading here". 
```suggestion
/-- The image of a left invariant measure under a left action is left invariant, assuming 
that the action preserves multiplication. -/
```
Similar for the additive version and all other docstrings.
This should be names either `SMulInvariantMeasure.map` or `smulInvariantMeasure_map`.
This should be named either `SMulInvariantMeasure.map_smul` or `smulInvariantMeasure_map_smul`.

I think this could be made slightly nicer by *not* picking a set `S` and just using the functorial properties of `map`. That seems to require an extra `MeasurableSMul` assumption but I think this is completely harmless. However we would need a bit more API, so I'll just do it in a separate PR once this is merged.
`rmul` is not really a standard name, could you use `mul_right` instead?

```suggestion
@[to_additive isMulLeftInvariant_map_add_right]
theorem isMulLeftInvariant_map_mul_right [IsMulLeftInvariant μ] (g : G) :
```

This name shouldn't have been changed:
```suggestion
@[to_additive isHaarMeasure_map_vadd
"The image of a Haar measure under map of a left additive action is again a Haar measure"]
theorem isHaarMeasure_map_smul {α} [BorelSpace G] [TopologicalGroup G] [T2Space G]
```

Actually, if `isHaarMeasure_map_vadd` is the autogenerated name, you don't have to specify it.
whoops!

```suggestion
@[to_additive isHaarMeasure_map_add_right
  "The image of a Haar measure under right addition is again a Haar measure."]
theorem isHaarMeasure_map_mul_right [BorelSpace G] [TopologicalGroup G] [T2Space G] (g : G) :
```

```suggestion
@[to_additive isMulRightInvariant_map_add_left
"The image of a right invariant measure under left addition is right invariant."]
instance isMulRightInvariant_map_mul_left [IsMulRightInvariant μ] (g : G) :
```

```suggestion
assuming that the action preserves addition."]
```

```suggestion
/-- The image of a right invariant measure under a left action is right invariant, assuming that
the action preserves multiplication. -/
@[to_additive "The image of a right invariant measure under a left additive action is right
 invariant, assuming that the action preserves addition."]
```

To be fully precise we would have to say that "preserves multiplication" doesn't mean the same thing here and above, but let's ignore that.

```suggestion
instance isHaarMeasure_map_smul {α} [BorelSpace G] [TopologicalGroup G] [T2Space G]
```

Sorry, forgot about this one.

```suggestion
  exact isHaarMeasure_map_smul μ (MulOpposite.op g)
```

```suggestion
    IsHaarMeasure (Measure.map (· * g) μ) :=
  isHaarMeasure_map_smul μ (MulOpposite.op g)
```

```suggestion
  toIsOpenPosMeasure :=
    (continuous_const_smul a).isOpenPosMeasure_map (MulAction.surjective a)
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: multiplication on the right preserves left invariant measures
